C:
Attachment by black, by far one of the most common responses to white's approach.

Some complex variations such as the small and large avalanche might arise from this position were White to continue with, 2.

[src:dobj, p. 8]: The most orthodox response, secures the corner.

_children.C: This is probably the simplest and most common response. White accepts a trade of territory for influence.

Starts the Avalanche variation which can get very complicated.

[src:dobj,II p. 24]: The avalanche pattern (after [q17]â€“[r15]) is the star of moden joseki and includes many perilous variations. There are also two simpler continuations.
